page.title: 14GLENLIVET SHOPPING
page.content: Up until a year ago there was a village shop in Bridgend of Glenlivet but it was closed down as it was no longer a profitable business. Most people now do their weekly shopping in the nearest town, travelling by car or by the bus service which runs twice a week. There are still weekly delivery vans which bring bread, fish, meat or groceries. These vans are mostly used by the elderly and those without their own transport. Still at Bridgend there is a post office which is used for drawing pensions and family allowances as well as for buying stamps. Two or three times a year large drapery vans visit the area which sell household utensils and furniture as well as cloths, sheet, etc. The mobile library visits once a fortnight with books to suit all.
